text.text:
I'd have given St Charles Borromeo Specialist Hospital a 5 Star rating if not for one or two discrepancies with Nigeria hospitals in general which is a general knowledge.

However, I'm giving it a 4 Star rating for good management, neatness, staff punctuality and friendliness (not all the staff members though).

The hospital is not that very big, compared to really big hospitals with state-of-the-art equipments. Outside of the hospital is enough parking space, especially the route to the Emergency Unit (this is commendable).

One other thing that is commendable is the fact that there is degree of orderliness in that people are attended to based on first come first served, much as IM cannot be ruled out in this country.

The hospital has mortuary and they do embalming etc...
One can easily buy caskets along the street leading to the hospital.

text.text: New hope used to be a good hospital but now, I don’t know why their thirst for money  clouds their judgment of saving lives. The series of unnecessary tests and scans, their delays and lackadaisical attitudes in order to prolong your stay which accumulates in the expenses and enriches their pockets is really appalling and should be looked into by whatever body that is in charge of the medical sector . You’d literally spend an arm and a leg 200-300k and at the end of the day you only av malaria. The worst part is, no one will tell you what they are treating you for except you probe. This is beyond evil! I don’t even want to enter the extent of how unprofessional they are cos that would be an epistle. But the essence of my gist is, we will be looking for another hospital. If not that Regina is far and for the matter of emergency I wouldn’t av bothered continued patronage. Y’all need to do better

text.text: Services here is soo slow, worse than a snail pace, only use this hospital if its not an emergency, you are not very ill, or you don't have anything important to do with the rest of your day... Prepare to get old waiting for little things as seeing a doctor, doing a scan, getting your drugs etc. Staff walking up and down yet nothing is hastened or made faster. And also know if you ain't family, friends or know face, you will spend extra time as they prioritize familiar faces. In summary, if you are willing to get old or possibly faint waiting for a simple service to be rendered, use this hospital

text.text:
With all due respect this hospital is of low starndard with good reviews maybe by family and friends or staffs but its not worth it. Doctor left me on the day scheduled for my endoscopy and told me he has a meeting that i should come tomorrow after waiting hungrily for About 5hrs. They gave me an appointment the next day by 10am which i came by 8:30am and waited hungrily again till 12 now and they vnt done it yet. The staffs are not well cultured in hospital management and patient relationship. Its just a general hospital in disguise. Emergency cases should to be managed here to avoid stories.
It is not a good experience for me at all.
Even the consultation was worth it. The doctor will ask you to wait outside for your verdict.
I just hope they improve cos this is not the starndard i expected by reading the reviews here before going.

text.text:
Since the upgrade from General Hospital to Federal Medical Center, there has not been any significant change in terms of infrastructure and staffing. I heard that the FEDERAL presence will befall the hospital by January 2024. We eagerly await January. This hospital needs enough Doctors that are humans, ones that take time to listen to the patients, ones that wouldn't be quick to dismiss patients, in the guise of having others to attend to.

When I heard about the upgrade, I was very happy, I still am. I have a special feeling about this, given that this is the same hospital where I was born.

Let's hope that this place gets a federal facelift in all aspects of it's operating.
One of the reasons I like here is that each case has a particular doctor that takes care of it.

The only issue I have here is concerning the staff members. Mostly they have this air of importance... playing god mostly.

text.text: Located close to General hospital, Guinness eye centre is where solutions are provided to optical related issues. The environment is okay and spacious.

originalText.text: Located close to General hospital, Guinness eye centre is where solutions are provided to optical related issues. The environment is okay and spacious.

text.text:
I could have given this place 5 Star, but for the needless bottlenecks and their refusal to upgrade to a modern database system of storing patients information...(you can't believe that they still use papers, and move files up and down). Nothing is new here. For most of my life, I've known this place (four decades), nothing is new except for some white elephant projects which are politically motivated.

The queues are usually worst on the first working day of the week. So if you want to see a Doctor, do well to go another day other than the first working day of the week. Also Fridays are not a good time to see Doctors because most of them don't even show up. This is not just the case of Guinness Eye Centre, but cuts across all of government own offices. It's already a menace, as workers don't show up on Fridays.

Aside these issues, this is a good place to get help for your eye problems. They are thorough with their treatments.

places.formattedAddress: 10C Osuma Rd, off Awka Road, Omagba Phase II, Onitsha 434104, Anambra, Nigeria

text.text:
Uno Ogwu Okoro (Okoro's Hospital) as it's widely known around Onitsha is situated at Osuma Street by Awka Road. It's not to far from former Total Filling Station Awka Road.

It's a very good place to be if you're looking to have surgery. They have up to 95% success rate...

Even as it's a private hospital, one is surprised at how inexpensive everything are, especially their labs, scans and tests.

The Chief doctor himself is very down-to-earth and jovial. He is a professional in all ramifications.

The only issue I have here is the staff members. They're mainly reluctant and lackadaisical in discharging their duties. They talk to people anyhow and with little or no manners.

displayName.text: Pioneer International Specialist Hospital And Maternity

text.text:
Using this hospital turn out to be a nightmare for me and my wife. My wife went to deliver in this hospital and was charged #150,000 as part payment deposit. I made the transfer on 21/09/2021 using my Access bank account to the hospital First Bank account which was successful.

We presented the receipt as proof of payment but the MD claimed that he has not seen the money because he didn’t get an alert. It happens, I understand.

I called my bank to make a complaint about the transfer and I was informed that the money was sent to the recipient account, but after complaining for days that the MD is adamant that he has not seen the money and he has refused to call his bank to confirm the deposit.

My bank has to write to First Bank requesting for details regarding the transfer, the feed from First bank was that the money was deposited successfully and the recipient has even gone ahead to withdraw the said money.

I provided the MD with the transfer Session ID as a proof and ask him to call his bank for confirmation but  he refused and insist that I have not made any transfer to him.

Today 28/09/2021 my wife was to be discharge but the MD refused and held her hostage pending when we send another #150,000 to him before she will be allowed to leave.

I made the transfer on the 21/09/2021, but up till today 28/09/2021 the hospital MD has refused to call his bank claiming that I did not make any transfer to him.

He has caused great grief and embarrassment to my family and great distress to my new born baby.

After embarrassing my family for days now and refusing to let her leave the hospital, he reluctantly call his bank and it was confirm that I made the transfer since the 21st.

Please be careful when using the hospital, I won’t wish what we passed through as a family in this hospital to anyone.

The MD been a learned man should have saved us this great embarrassment by calling his bank/account officer to resolve this issue but he refused, an issue that won’t take 5 minute or cost him 100 naira call credit but he choose to embarrass before the whole hospital and also detain her from leaving the hospital.

I am in pains and tears writing this.

We presented the receipt as proof of payment but the MD claimed that he has not seen the money because he didn’t get an alert. It happens, I understand.

I called my bank to make a complaint about the transfer and I was informed that the money was sent to the recipient account, but after complaining for days that the MD is adamant that he has not seen the money and he has refused to call his bank to confirm the deposit.

My bank has to write to First Bank requesting for details regarding the transfer, the feed from First bank was that the money was deposited successfully and the recipient has even gone ahead to withdraw the said money.

I provided the MD with the transfer Session ID as a proof and ask him to call his bank for confirmation but  he refused and insist that I have not made any transfer to him.

Today 28/09/2021 my wife was to be discharge but the MD refused and held her hostage pending when we send another #150,000 to him before she will be allowed to leave.

I made the transfer on the 21/09/2021, but up till today 28/09/2021 the hospital MD has refused to call his bank claiming that I did not make any transfer to him.

He has caused great grief and embarrassment to my family and great distress to my new born baby.

After embarrassing my family for days now and refusing to let her leave the hospital, he reluctantly call his bank and it was confirm that I made the transfer since the 21st.

Please be careful when using the hospital, I won’t wish what we passed through as a family in this hospital to anyone.

The MD been a learned man should have saved us this great embarrassment by calling his bank/account officer to resolve this issue but he refused, an issue that won’t take 5 minute or cost him 100 naira call credit but he choose to embarrass before the whole hospital and also detain her from leaving the hospital.
